reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Supporting the National Response to HIV/AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria in Angola

description.narrative: Angola - Multicomponent - United Nations Development Programme - UNDP Angola. This program has the following goals: Reduce by 60% the morbidity and mortality of malaria in the country by 2020 compared to baseline in 2016. Reduce the malaria-related mortality (number of malaria deaths per 1000 population) by 60% from 53,8% in 2016 to 21,5% by 2020. Reduce TB incidence by 20% by 2021 compared to 2015 level. Strengthening the national response for the control of STI/HIV and viral Hepatitis to ensure an HIV prevalence rate of less than 3% by 2022. Reduce TB mortality by 35% by 2021 compared to 2015 level. The objectives of this program are: By the end of 2020, at least 80% of the target population uses an adequate preventive measure against malaria. Detect 85% of estimated new cases of smear positive TB and achieve a treatment success rate of 85% of all forms smear positive TB cases by 2022. By the end of 2020, 100% of suspected malaria cases at health facility are tested before receiving treatment;. Increase the detection rate of MDR TB and treat 100% of diagnosed MDR TB cases by 2022. By the end of 2020, 100% of malaria cases testing positive are treated according to the national guidelines, at all levels of the national health pyramid. Ensure 90% of people living with HIV including key and vulnerable populations knows their status by 2022. Ensure 90% of all people diagnosed with HIV including key and vulnerable populations, are enrolled, followed and receive timely and efficacious highly active antiretroviral therapy by 2022. Increase PMTCT coverage from 39% to 90% of HIV positive pregnant women by 2018 2021. By 2020, strengthen the epidemiology surveillance system, monitoring and evaluation and operational research for Malaria;. Ensure 90% of all people receiving the antiretroviral therapy including key and vulnerable populations ,attain sustainable viral suppression by 2022. By 2020, strengthen the management, technical and institutional capacities of the National Malaria Control Program (NMCP) at all levels, to enable efficient and sustainable implementation of the planned activities of the NMCP.. Expand TB/HIV collaborative activities by ensuring that 90% of notified TB patients are tested for HIV and 100% who test HIV positive are put on ART promptly and managed. Strengthen management of a decentralised national TB/HIV response and institute an efficient and integrated M&E system that ensures all indicators listed are tracked and reported timely.

description.narrative: Living support to client/ target population (LSCTP)

title.narrative: Impact indicator for AGO-Z-UNDP
Inpatient malaria deaths per year: rate per 100,000 persons per year
Percentage of people living with HIV
TB mortality rate per 100,000 population
Malaria test positivity rate
Confirmed malaria cases (microscopy or RDT): rate per 1000 persons per year
Malaria parasite prevalence: Proportion of children aged 6-59 months with malaria infection
RR-TB and/or MDR-TB prevalence among new TB patients: Proportion of new TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB
Estimated percentage of children newly infected with HIV from mother-to-child transmission among women living with HIV delivering in the past 12 months
TB/HIV mortality rate per 100,000 population
TB incidence rate per 100,000 population
Coverage / Output indicator for AGO-Z-UNDP
Percentage of reporting units reporting no stock-outs of anti-TB drugs on the last day of the quarter
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to at-risk populations through mass campaigns
Percentage of adults (15 and above) on ART among all adults living with HIV at the end of the reporting period
Percentage of sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment
Proportion of health facilities without stock-outs of key commodities during the reporting period
Percentage of HIV-positive women who received ART during pregnancy and/or labour and delivery
CM- Other 1: Proportion of health facilities without stock-out of key commodities (ACTs) during the reporting period
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to targeted risk groups through continuous distribution
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test at public sector health facilities
Percentage of young people aged 10–24 years reached by comprehensive sexuality education and/or life skills–based HIV education out of schools
Timeliness of facility reporting: Percentage of submitted facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are received on time per the national guidelines
Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment
Percentage of adolescent girls and young women (AGYW) reached with HIV prevention programs- defined package of services
Completeness of facility reporting: Percentage of expected facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are actually received
Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified
Percentage of children (under 15) on ART among all children living with HIV at the end of the reporting period
Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases
Percentage of MSM reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of men who have sex with men reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of people living with HIV currently receiving antiretroviral therapy
Percentage of people on ART among all people living with HIV at the end of the reporting period
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment at public sector health facilities
Proportion of pregnant women attending antenatal clinics who received three or more doses of intermittent preventive treatment for malaria

Treatment success rate- all forms: Percentage of TB cases, all forms, bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, successfully treated (cured plus treatment completed) among all TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period, new and relapse cases
Percentage of pregnant women who know their HIV status
Percentage of registered new and relapse TB patients with documented HIV status
Outcome indicator for AGO-Z-UNDP
Case notification rate of all forms of TB per 100,000 population - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
Proportion of households with at least one insecticide-treated net for every two people and/or sprayed by IRS within the last 12 months
Proportion of population that slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Proportion of children under five years old who slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Proportion of pregnant women who slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Percentage of men reporting the use of a condom the last time they had anal sex with a non regular partner
Percentage of people living with HIV who know their HIV status at the end of the reporting period
Percentage of sex workers reporting the use of a condom with their most recent client
Proportion of households with at least one insecticide-treated net for every two people
Notification of RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases – Percentage of notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed, drug resistant RR-TB and/or MDR-TB as a proportion of all estimated RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases
Percentage of adults and children with HIV, known to be on treatment 12 months after initiation of antiretroviral therapy

TB treatment coverage: Percentage of new and relapse cases that were notified and treated among the estimated number of incident TB cases in the same year (all form of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed)
Treatment success rate of all forms of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
Percentage of people living with HIV and on ART who are virologically suppressed
Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated
